DataElement.preferredName: Mental Health Service Recovery Orientation and Care Quality - Family Member Perception Assessment Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The overall state of an individual's psychologic constitution._Work, or a product of that work, done by one person or group that benefits another._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._A person's awareness of self with regard to time, place, and personal relationships._The work of attending to someone or something._An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth._Any of the individuals who are descended from a common progenitor, related by marriage or other legal tie, or by a feeling of closeness._The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus._the scale to determine the patient's assessment of general health.

A person's awareness of self with regard to time, place, and personal relationships.

The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.

PermissibleValues.value: Not Applicable/have not received instructions about taking 6MP
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not Applicable Have Negation Receive Instruction Approximate Take Six Mercaptopurine

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not Applicable Have Negation Receive Instruction Approximate Take Six Mercaptopurine
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.: Used to describe the possession, relationships, or the state of something or someone.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: To take, accept, or get something offered.: A message describing how something is to be done.: Not quite exact or correct; almost exact or correct.: As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.: A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
Used to describe the possession, relationships, or the state of something or someone.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
A message describing how something is to be done.
Not quite exact or correct; almost exact or correct.
As pertains to a medication: ingest, inhale, instill, or inject.
A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.

A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not quite exact or correct; almost exact or correct.: One of two equal parts; a quantity corresponding to one half of the whole.: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: Not quite exact or correct; almost exact or correct.
One of two equal parts; a quantity corresponding to one half of the whole.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ReferenceDocuments.name: The family member version of
ReferenceDocuments.description: The family member version of The Recovery Self-Assessment (RSA) is a 32-item, self-administered rating scale that focuses on perceptions of recovery principles and overall quality of services, including determination, staff helpfulness, and staff responsiveness.
